title: Govt announces Tk 50 lakhs reward if anyone can handover Hadi’s shooter to police
body: Operation Devil Hunt phase 2 to start soon: home adviser Home adviser Jahangir Alam Chowdhury, while addressing a media briefing on Saturday, announced that the government would reward Tk 50 lakhs to anyone if they can handover the shooters, who launched a gun attack on Sharif Osman Hadi, to the law enforcers. Hadi, an aspiring independent candidate for Dhaka-8 constituency in the upcoming national elections and also the spokesperson of the Inquilab Mancha, was shot in the head in Dhaka’s Bijoynagar area on Friday afternoon. He is now undergoing treatment at Evercare Hospital in Dhaka in a critical condition. Home ministry organised the briefing at the secretariat after an emergency law-and-order meeting held at home ministry. The home adviser said that the government was committed to ensure security for all July frontline fighters. ‘A special committee has been formed to ensure security for July fighters security,’ he said, adding that the committee would decide the next action plan. The home adviser also said that the government was going to start the second phase of the Operation Devil Hunt to improve law-and-order situation of Bangladesh before the upcoming national elections. He also said that the government would allow fire arms for the electoral candidates. The government would issue new arms licences or return the surrendered firearms to the respective owners upon requests from the electoral candidates, he added.
